author: josephperrott
message:
build: rename "no-ivy-aot" tag to "view-engine-only" (#43862)

Using the tag "view-engine-only" better describes the expected usage of bazel targets with the test. They can
only be run with view engine.

PR Close #43862

files.patch:
@@ -381,7 +381,7 @@ jobs:
           # See /tools/saucelabs/README.md for more info
           command: |
             yarn bazel run //tools/saucelabs:sauce_service_setup
-            TESTS=$(./node_modules/.bin/bazelisk query --output label '(kind(karma_web_test, ...) intersect attr("tags", "saucelabs", ...)) except attr("tags", "no-ivy-aot", ...) except attr("tags", "fixme-saucelabs-ivy", ...)')
+            TESTS=$(./node_modules/.bin/bazelisk query --output label '(kind(karma_web_test, ...) intersect attr("tags", "saucelabs", ...)) except attr("tags", "view-engine-only", ...) except attr("tags", "fixme-saucelabs-ivy", ...)')
             yarn bazel test --config=saucelabs ${TESTS}
             yarn bazel run //tools/saucelabs:sauce_service_stop
           no_output_timeout: 40m
@@ -789,11 +789,11 @@ jobs:
       - setup_win
       - run:
           name: Build all windows CI targets
-          command: bazel build --build_tag_filters=-no-ivy-aot,-fixme-ivy-aot //packages/compiler-cli/...
+          command: bazel build --config=ivy --build_tag_filters=-view-engine-only,-fixme-ivy-aot //packages/compiler-cli/...
           no_output_timeout: 15m
       - run:
           name: Test all windows CI targets
-          command: bazel test --test_tag_filters="-no-ivy-aot,-fixme-ivy-aot,-browser:chromium-local" //packages/compiler-cli/... //packages/localize/...
+          command: bazel test --config=ivy --test_tag_filters="-view-engine-only,-fixme-ivy-aot,-browser:chromium-local" //packages/compiler-cli/... //packages/localize/...
           no_output_timeout: 15m
       # Save dependencies to use on subsequent runs.
       - save_cache:

@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@ load(":angular_integration_test.bzl", "angular_integration_test")
 
 # Map of integration tests to tags.
 # A subset of these tests fail or are not meant to be run with ivy bundles. These are tagged
-# "no-ivy-aot".
+# "view-engine-only".
 INTEGRATION_TESTS = {
     "bazel": {
         "tags": [

@@ -98,7 +98,7 @@ yarn bazel test //integration:bazel-schematics_test
 
 When adding a new integration test, follow the steps below to add a bazel test target for the new test.
 
-1. Add new test to `INTEGRATION_TESTS` object in `/integration/BUILD.bazel` (and tag as `"no-ivy-aot"` if not meant to be run against ivy bundles).
+1. Add new test to `INTEGRATION_TESTS` object in `/integration/BUILD.bazel` (and tag as `"view-engine-only"` if not meant to be run against ivy bundles).
 2. If test requires ports and does not support ethereal ports then make sure the port is unique and add it to the "manually configured ports" comment to document which port it is using
 3. Add at least the following two entries `.bazelignore` (as they may contain BUILD files)
    1. `integration/new_test/node_modules`

@@ -24,8 +24,8 @@
     "/ ": "",
     "postinstall": "node scripts/webdriver-manager-update.js && node --preserve-symlinks --preserve-symlinks-main ./tools/postinstall-patches.js",
     "prepare": "husky install",
-    "test": "bazelisk test --build_tag_filters=-no-ivy-aot --test_tag_filters=-no-ivy-aot",
-    "test-view-engine-only": "bazelisk test --config=view-engine --build_tag_filters=no-ivy-aot --test_tag_filters=no-ivy-aot",
+    "test": "bazelisk test --build_tag_filters=-view-engine-only --test_tag_filters=-view-engine-only",
+    "test-view-engine-only": "bazelisk test --config=view-engine --build_tag_filters=view-engine-only --test_tag_filters=view-engine-only",
     "test-ivy-aot": "echo \\`test-ivy-aot\\` no longer valid, use \\`yarn test\\` instead",
     "test-non-ivy": "echo \\`test-ivy-aot\\` no longer valid, use \\`yarn test-view-engine-only\\` instead",
     "test-tsec": "bazelisk test //... --build_tag_filters=tsec --test_tag_filters=tsec",

@@ -81,7 +81,7 @@ jasmine_node_test(
     # We don't want to run the example_package golden test with Ivy yet. Currently the golden
     # file is based on non-ivy output and therefore won't work for ngc and Ivy at the same time.
     # TODO: We should be able to have another golden for ivy-aot as well.
-    tags = ["no-ivy-aot"],
+    tags = ["view-engine-only"],
     deps = ["@npm//diff"],
 )

@@ -1,8 +1,8 @@
-package(default_visibility = ["//visibility:public"])
-
 load("@build_bazel_rules_nodejs//:index.bzl", "nodejs_test")
 load("//tools:defaults.bzl", "nodejs_binary")
 
+package(default_visibility = ["//visibility:public"])
+
 nodejs_binary(
     name = "ngc_bin",
     data = [
@@ -65,6 +65,6 @@ nodejs_test(
         # TODO(josephperrott): reenable or remove test after investigating the cause of failures
         # on windows CI runs.
         "manual",
-        "no-ivy-aot",
+        "view-engine-only",
     ],
 )

@@ -16,7 +16,7 @@ ng_module(

         # Disabled as this test is specific to the flat module indexing of metadata.json files that
         # the old ngc compiler does. Ivy has no metadata.json files so this test does not apply.
-        "no-ivy-aot",
+        "view-engine-only",
     ],
     deps = [
         "//packages/core",
@@ -37,6 +37,6 @@ jasmine_node_test(
     tags = [
         # Disabled as this test is specific to the flat module indexing of metadata.json files that
         # the old ngc compiler does. Ivy has no metadata.json files so this test does not apply.
-        "no-ivy-aot",
+        "view-engine-only",

 )

     deps = [
         ":extract_i18n_lib",
@@ -86,7 +86,7 @@ jasmine_node_test(

         ":ngc_lib",

@@ -30,7 +30,7 @@ jasmine_node_test(
     tags = [

@@ -85,7 +85,7 @@ jasmine_node_test(

         # Disabled as these tests pertain to the old ngc compilation and are not relevant in Ivy.

@@ -59,7 +59,7 @@ Running all Ivy karma tests in Saucelabs:
 
 ``` bash
 yarn bazel run //tools/saucelabs:sauce_service_setup
-TESTS=$(./node_modules/.bin/bazelisk query --output label '(kind(karma_web_test, ...) intersect attr("tags", "saucelabs", ...)) except attr("tags", "no-ivy-aot", ...) except attr("tags", "fixme-saucelabs-ivy", ...)')
+TESTS=$(./node_modules/.bin/bazelisk query --output label '(kind(karma_web_test, ...) intersect attr("tags", "saucelabs", ...)) except attr("tags", "view-engine-only", ...) except attr("tags", "fixme-saucelabs-ivy", ...)')
 yarn bazel test --config=saucelabs ${TESTS}
 ```
